visualization_prompt: Generate a Highcharts organization chart showing hierarchical relationships between nodes A, B, C, D, and E using explicit link type declarations (straight/curved) and custom styling.

title.text: Organization Chart: Different type of links

visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a 5-node hierarchy with 4 directed edges. Nodes are categorical entities (organizational roles), and links define reporting structures. Synthetic data adheres to hierarchical constraints (no cycles) and includes two link types (straight/curved). The organization chart minimizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines/borders while maximizing node contrast (#0073e6 against #f9f9f9 background). Cairo’s principles are applied through position encoding (vertical hierarchy) and link curvature for visual differentiation. Node radius (30px) and font size (14px) ensure perceptual salience. Export settings optimize rasterization at 800x600px with HTML-enabled annotations.
